executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency. Households now consider pets as an integral part of the family more than ever. In recent years, a record-high pet ownership rate and shifting attitudes have boosted spending on pet care services, including transportation. The broader pet care sector has flourished as pet owners sought the best for their pets. The industry's growth trajectory was disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic, as work-from-home settings and travel restrictions left more pet owners at home than ever before, leading revenue to sink for the first time in a decade. Yet an unprecedented spike in pet ownership during the pandemic has shifted the industry's landscape, with demand for pet transportation services outpacing supply post-COVID. Pet owners' steep spending on pets has led industry-wide revenue to expand at a CAGR of 0.7% over the past five years, totaling an estimated $2.2 billion, including an expected 0.9% increase in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Industry Revenue Depends on Consumer Spending
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: For the pet transportation industry, individual consumers seeking to travel or who are forced to relocate comprise the primary customer base. The services usually include discretionary purchases like family vacations and specialized relocation services for military members.

The number of cats and dogs in the US surged in 2020 as COVID-19 lockdowns led consumers to look for companionship by adopting a pet. However, the rise in revenue throughout 2024 was partially offset by a decline in 2020 as consumers could not travel due to the pandemic. Still, more disposable income and pets in the US translates to a greater need for the industry's services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: PET TRANSPORTERS WILL MOVE FURTHER INTO THEIR NICHES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: TO PROVIDE MORE SPECIALIZED SERVICES US pet transporters will increasingly proliferate into specialized market niches, differentiating their portfolios with a focus on safety, comfort and consumer feedback.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STEADY DEMAND THROUGHOUT THE OUTLOOK PERIOD CAN BE
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: ATTRIBUTED TO A RISE IN THE NUMBER OF PETS The rise in the number of pets will continue to boost demand for pet transportation services as per capita disposable income grows and economic conditions improve.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry facilitate the transportation of pets and other animals.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level - low - steady

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Number of pets (cats and dogs)

key_trends: The price of pet transportation services is a major form of competition. Pet transporters must ensure that prices are competitive so that customers remain loyal.

Pet transporting companies benefit from being located near veterinarians and other animal establishments. By operating near these facilities, operators can minimize costs spent on acquiring key customers.

A jump in pet ownership during COVID-19 has overwhelmed pet transportation services. Pet owners who are eager to travel and return to the office have pushed more owners to acquire specialized pet transportation services.

Rising incomes and shifting attitudes toward pets will encourage owners to spend on transportation services. Pet transporters will take advantage of this through new offerings focusing on convenience and total pet wellness.
Pet transporters don't benefit from any specific government assistance. The industry does receive some indirect assistance from various related industry associations.
The increasing population diversity has improved demand for the industry's services. Younger demographics tend to want to travel with their pets more often.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment refers to pet owners between the ages of 18 to 29 years old. Pet owners in this age group tend to travel the most since they are typically still settling into their careers. Since people in this age group tend to move around more, their pets will also require reliable transportation services.

This segment refers to pet owners between the ages of 30 to 49 years old. Pet owners in this age group tend to travel a bit less than the younger segment. Since people in this segment are typically already settled into their careers and have families, moving tends to be a much more arduous process. As a result, the need for pet transportation services is slightly less than the youngest segment.

This segment refers to pet owners between the ages of 50 and 64. Pet owners in this age group tend to travel less than the previous segments. People in this age group are most likely settled down in a stable home with their pets. Most of the travel in this segment is for vacation purposes. Vacation is typically when this segment will utilize pet transportation services.

This segment refers to pet owners aged 65 and older. Pet owners in this age group tend to travel the least. As a result, pet owners older than 65 account for the smallest share of revenue in the pet transportation industry.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Air Travel Remains the Most Popular Mode of Transportation
products_and_services.product_description: Air travel transportation is when a pet is boarded onto an airplane and is either stored below the plane, or next to its owner. This is the most popular way to transport pets since it is usually necessary when the owner needs to travel somewhere far with their pet.

Moving a pet via road travel involves transporting it either on a car, train, bus, or any other ground transportation system. Demand for road travel transportation services is the smallest since many owners can do this service themselves and bypass industry operators.

Military relocation involves specialized services to military personnel and their families when they must move to a new station or base. Since the number of pets is on the rise, every time a military family needs to relocate, they often need assistance in transporting their pets safely and efficiently, thus making military relocations the second-largest segment.

tier_2_suppliers: Pet Transportation Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of pets measures the number of cats and dogs in households in the US. Demand for pet transportation services rises when the number of pets increases since people are more likely to need to transport pets. A rise in the number of pets represents a potential opportunity for the industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages are the largest expense here
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages and other labor expenditures are the biggest expense for operators, much like in other professional services industries.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Certain types of transportation services come with a higher price tag than other alternatives, so high per capita disposable income is essential for sales. Disposable income levels also dictate how likely consumers are to travel, which would result in an increase in pet transportation services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Deployment of Safety and Efficiency Systems
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Companies use GPS tracking systems to help prevent pets from getting lost and provide live updates on trip progress to the consumer. Infrastructure modernization and improvements, including the construction of new rail lines and bus rapid transit systems, are also key innovations in the industry.

FAQs.question: What is the revenue volatility for this industry?
FAQs.answer: The text indicates MODERATE revenue volatility.

FAQs.question: Can disposable income be volatile for this industry?
FAQs.answer: Yes, the text states that disposable income can be volatile: "Disposable income levels also dictate how likely consumers are to travel, which would result in an increase in pet transportation services."

FAQs.question: What is the level of regulation for this industry?
FAQs.answer: The text indicates LOW regulation and STEADY regulation for this industry.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The text indicates LOW assistance and STEADY assistance for this industry.
